avalancheActivity.comment: Some small avalanches fell in W-facing hills in the Hengill area after a lot of snowfall between christmas and new years. A small slab avalanche from a cornice was triggered by staff member of Bláfjöll on the 3rd of January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Risk of wet avalanches will increase on Monday in rain/thaw weather. Wind slabs in western aspects have likely gotten wet and lost cohesion.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of new snow fell at the end of december that has been transported, buried or been through melt-freeze cycles. At least 40 cm of new snow has fallen since. A snowpit was taken in the Bláfjöll ski resort on the 3rd of January that showed a shallow weakness in the snowpack. Stiff slab snow has formed on top of a weaker powder snow and this could be expected widely in W-facing hills. Cohesion with older layers seemed good. Thaw is expected to start on Sunday with temporal instability in the snowpack that will break down the slab.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in easterly winds last weeks in the North and East of the country and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Snow will likely melt a lot in the southern and western sides of the country. A weakness was discovered in the snowpack in the North at around 1000 m elevation in SE aspects. Very weak layering was also discovered at a shallow depth in wind slabs in the Eastfjords.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Considerable snow is in mountains that will melt and loose cohesion temporarily.

weatherForecast.highlights: Mikil hlýindi og rigning fylgja SA strekking seinnipart Sunnudags. Hiti mun ná allt að 4 gráðum upp til fjalla og er búist við því að þessi hlýindi haldist að miklu leyti út næstu viku. Úrkomuákefð nær hámarki um mánudagskvöld.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wet slab released in Kirkjubólshlíð on Tuesday.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Warm weather can cuase instability to begin with.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow in the end of December and couple of dry avalanches fell. Warm weather can cuase instability to begin with.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in easterly winds last weeks in the North and East of the country and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Snow will likely melt a lot in the southern and western sides of the country. A weakness was discovered in the snowpack in the North at around 1000 m elevation in SE aspects. Very weak layering was also discovered at a shallow depth in wind slabs in the Eastfjords.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvöss S-átt og hlýtt næstu daga. Frostlaust til fjalla. Lítilsháttar rigning.

avalancheActivity.comment: Large avalanches were recorded in Skíðadalur on January 2nd and likely released due to warming on 1st and 2nd of January. A size 2.5 avalanche was likely released by snowmobilers in Hólsdalur on Dec 30th. An avalanche was reported on S aspect in Ólafsfjörður Dec 31st. Another large avalanche, size 3.5 was released on SW facing aspect in Hestskarðshnjúkur on Dec 30th as well as a few smaller ones.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Warm weather can cuase instability to begin with.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow fell in NE-wind in the last days. On Monday and Tuesday warming reached up to around 600 m and has affected the snow with crust forming and strengthening of snow pack. Above 600 m, the snow is still dry and persistant weakness can be found in the snow pack in upper elevations. Warm weather can cuase instability to begin with.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in easterly winds last weeks in the North and East of the country and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Snow will likely melt a lot in the southern and western sides of the country. A weakness was discovered in the snowpack in the North at around 1000 m elevation in SE aspects. Very weak layering was also discovered at a shallow depth in wind slabs in the Eastfjords.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Considerable snow is in mountains that will melt and loose cohesion temporarily.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi hlýindi og suðlæg átt næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: Dry slab avalanches fell in SW facing hills in Eskifjörður and Fagridalur on January 5th after the new snow. Many wet slab avalanches also fell on the 1st - 2nd of January in the region. The largest of those where estimated to be 3,5 in size. Most of them fell within the elevation range of 4-500 meters in SW facing hills. Wet loose avalanches also fell in Seyðisfjörður in the same episode.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow in the mountains since Friday. Unstable wind slabs are present in S-SW facing hills. Rapid warming on Sunday has caused more instability in the snowpack.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A weak layer is present within the snowpack at shallow depth and instability increased in the thaw episode that started on Sunday. 15-30 cm of new snow fell in the region in NE winds on Thursday. Wind slabs formed with very weak layering in S-SW facing hills. A lot of new snow fell in early january that melted shortly after. This triggered many wet avalanches in the region.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in easterly winds last weeks in the North and East of the country and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Snow will likely melt a lot in the southern and western sides of the country. A weakness was discovered in the snowpack in the North at around 1000 m elevation in SE aspects. Very weak layering was also discovered at a shallow depth in wind slabs in the Eastfjords.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Instability in the snowpack will increase in a thawing weather that starts on Sunday and lasts into the week. Considerable snow is in mountains that will melt and loose cohesion temporarily.

weatherForecast.highlights: SV breytileg átt og hröð hlýindi upp úr hádegi á Sunnudag. Hvessir með mánudeginum í 14-16 m/sek víðast hvar en allt að 30 m/sek upp til fjalla, hiti víðast 4-8 gráður en frostmark til fjalla.
